p: By age of fossil fuel violence, I refer here both to the violent material and biophysical impacts (direct and indirect) of fossil fuels themselves and the vast state-corporate apparatuses (see Simpson, 2019) that drive dispossessions and structural violence in the name of promoting extractivism as progress. This term seeks, as with Michael Watts' ‘petro-violence’, to refer to ecological and social violence (Watts, 2001), and can be (as is here) inextricably interlinked with setter-colonial violence (see also Whyte, 2018).
